newsitem.title: USA: U.S. normal butane holds much of yesterday's gain.
newsitem.headline: U.S. normal butane holds much of yesterday's gain.

text.p: U.S. spot prices for normal butane held onto much of yesterday's gains in midday trade on Wednesday amid continued interest in the product by petrochemical companies and traders.
In the U.S. Gulf Coast, Mont Belvieu, Texas, normal butane stayed steady at 39.75 cents and 40.00 cents a gallon after gaining 1.25 cents on Tuesday.
Such players as Exxon, Warren and Enron were heard in the market Tuesday buying barrels for petrochemical concerns.
In Conway, Kansas, spot normal butane drifted down about a quarter cent after gaining a penny Tuesday. Players were still shipping barrels south but in lesser quantity.
A luncheon in the hub also dampened activity on Wednesday.

On the back of stronger natural gas futures, Belvieu ethane traded at 20.25 cents, up a quarter from yesterday. Ethane mix traded hands at 18.75 cents, also up a quarter. --((Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk, 212 859-1631))
